name.en: Building Information Modeling: Theory and Applications
name.ch: 建築資訊模型理論與應用

goal.ch:
"This course focuses on the role of BIM in the AEC (Architecture, Engineering and Construction) industry, and it covers recent developments in the area of IPD (Integrated Project Delivery), both of which have a great potential to better project outcomes and maximize efficiency.  IPD is a project delivery approach that is almost a prerequisite for successful BIM projects.  It integrates people, systems, business structures and practices into a process that helps optimization of project results, increases value to the owner and end user, reduces waste, and maximizes efficiency through all phases of design, fabrication, construction and life cycle of the building.  In addition, the course brings cutting-edge and emerging technology solutions into the classroom and tries to link these solutions into the BIM environment.  Students will learn BIM authoring and specialty applications and construction management functions.  Overall, they will gain the following skills and knowledge:
? Familiarity with the current BIM technologies
? Applications of Autodesk Revit to construction domain knowledge
? An understanding of the linking and maintaining continuity of existing and designed BIM information and other vital information, such as vendors for specific materials, location of details and quantities required for estimation, bidding and scheduling into the model
? Understanding of Revit plugin programming"
goal.en:
"This course focuses on the role of BIM in the AEC (Architecture, Engineering and Construction) industry, and it covers recent developments in the area of IPD (Integrated Project Delivery), both of which have a great potential to better project outcomes and maximize efficiency.  IPD is a project delivery approach that is almost a prerequisite for successful BIM projects.  It integrates people, systems, business structures and practices into a process that helps optimization of project results, increases value to the owner and end user, reduces waste, and maximizes efficiency through all phases of design, fabrication, construction and life cycle of the building.  In addition, the course brings cutting-edge and emerging technology solutions into the classroom and tries to link these solutions into the BIM environment.  Students will learn BIM authoring and specialty applications and construction management functions.  Overall, they will gain the following skills and knowledge:
? Familiarity with the current BIM technologies
? Applications of Autodesk Revit to construction domain knowledge
? An understanding of the linking and maintaining continuity of existing and designed BIM information and other vital information, such as vendors for specific materials, location of details and quantities required for estimation, bidding and scheduling into the model
? Understanding of Revit plugin programming"

outline.ch: "Building Information Modeling (BIM) technique is a centralized data-rich virtual project model that facilitates documentation, design exploration, model-based quantity takeoff and estimating, interference checking, construction coordination and sequencing, digital fabrication, and 3-D building information capture and visualization.  In this course, students will learn BIM’s use in the industry (by different disciplines), examine geometry, spatial relationships, building information, quantities and properties of building components, and understand the benefit and improvement areas BIM offers.  Autodesk Revit and C# will be used to illustrate BIM."
outline.en: "Building Information Modeling (BIM) technique is a centralized data-rich virtual project model that facilitates documentation, design exploration, model-based quantity takeoff and estimating, interference checking, construction coordination and sequencing, digital fabrication, and 3-D building information capture and visualization.  In this course, students will learn BIM’s use in the industry (by different disciplines), examine geometry, spatial relationships, building information, quantities and properties of building components, and understand the benefit and improvement areas BIM offers.  Autodesk Revit and C# will be used to illustrate BIM."

textbook.ch: "Eastman, C.; Teicholz, P.; Sacks, R.; Liston, K. (2008) BIM Handbook: A Guide to Building Information Modeling for Owners, Managers, Designers, Engineers and Contractors. New York: Wiley. 504 pp."
textbook.en:
"Required: (in English) Autodesk. (2017) Revit Fundamentals with Videos. http://help.autodesk.com/view/RVT/2017/ENU/
Recommended: Eastman, C., Teicholz, P., Sacks, R., and Liston, L. (2011) BIM Handbook: A Guide to Building Information Modeling for Owners, Managers, Designers, Engineers and Contractors, 2nd Edition, Wiley.
 Eastman, C. (1999) Building Product Models: Computer Environments, Supporting Design and Construction, CRC Press.
 Selected Case Studies."

gradMethod.ch:

      Group Project   45
      TOTAL   100"

flexDiscription.ch: 本課程最後兩週，為同學期末報告、互相評論及老師講評，與最後的報告調整。
flexDiscription.en: In the last two weeks of this course, students will make final reports, provide mutual comments with the instructor's comments, and adjust the final report.

ch.competencies: 策劃及執行專題研究之能力
研發創新及獨立解決問題之能力
跨領域協調整合之能力
國際觀及永續發展理念
領導、管理及規劃之能力
終身自我學習成長之能力

en.competencies: The Ability of Planning and Implementing Research Projects
The Ability in Writing Technical Papers
The Ability in Research, Innovation, and Problem Solving
The Ability of Interdisciplinary Integration and Coordination
International Perspective and Concept of Sustainable Development
